thread.title: Local roundup: Fitch football makes it 4 in a row
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Fitch football makes it 4 in a row

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Fitch football makes it 4 in a row
text: • Ledyard wears down Griswold GUILFORD — Rob Duncan finished 11-for-16 passing for 164 yards and a touchdown and Fitch earned its fourth straight win, 31-20, over Guilford in a nonleague football game on Friday. Cevon Riley (66 yards) and Parker Gibson (55 yards) each scored on long touchdown runs in the third quarter for the Falcons (4-1), while Duncan threw a 43-yard touchdown to Luke Letellier in the fourth quarter. Riley finished with 96 rushing yards and Cleon McLish added a touchdown on the ground. Pingree 30 Hyde-Woodstock 14 WOODSTOCK — The Wolfpack fell behind 21-0 in the first half before mounting a third-quarter comeback that ultimately fell short. Sean Duffy blocked a punt and returned it to the end zone to put Hyde-Woodstock (2-1) on the board. Jordan Burney scored on a 6-yard run to get the Wolfpack within a score, but Pingree added a safety and touchdown in the fourth to seal the game. FIELD HOCKEY East Lyme 6 Fitch-Ledyard 0 EAST LYME — Cara Bradley scored a pair of unassisted goals before making it a hat trick off a pass from Lauren Abbey in East Lyme’s win. Abbey, Alexis Burgess and Kaihley Rafferty also scored for the Vikings (9-2-1, 8-2-1 ECC). Fitch-Ledyard fell to 0-10, 0-8. VOLLEYBALL Glastonbury 3 Fitch 1 GROTON — The Falcons battled back to tie the match after dropping the opening set, but Glastonbury took the next two, 25-12, 26-24, to take down the last undefeated team in the ECC. Mae Sefransky dished out 32 assists for Fitch (14-1) and Jen Severino had 13 kills. Killingly 3 Norwich Tech 0 KILLINGLY — Ally Conde posted 12 kills, four aces and three blocks to propel the Redgals to their fourth consecutive victory. Cara Mayhew added 20 points and seven aces and Christina McDermott had 18 assists, five digs and four aces for Killingly (9-6). Madison Bodley had six kills for the Warriors (8-4), who had won two in a row entering the match. Plainfield 3 Wheeler 0 PLAINFIELD — The Panthers won the first set, 33-31, and carried that momentum to a sweep. Jamie Beauregard had 12 service points and 11 digs for Plainfield (10-5, 3-2 ECC Small) and Natalia Rickey posted five blocks and seven kills. The Panthers have won five in a row. The Lions fell to 6-9, 1-5. NFA 3 Bacon 0 NORWICH — MacKenzie Burke recorded 10 kills and 14 digs to lead the Wildcats to a 25-8, 25-18, 25-18 win. Kayley Ericson dished out 36 assists for NFA (7-6, 2-3 ECC Large) and Kate-Lyn Nol had 14 service points and seven aces. Page 2 of 2 - Elizabeth Kowalsky had 15 digs for the Bobcats (4-13, 0-7). East Lyme 3 Woodstock 2 WOODSTOCK — Maggy Powers had 17 kills and Carly Puckett added 16 as the Vikings won the last two sets to break the Centaurs’ eight-match win streak in five sets, 28-26, 18-25, 19-25, 25-15, 15-11. Alexis Bell had 51 assists for East Lyme (9-3, 4-2 ECC Large). Jacqueline Low had 25 kills and Amanda Haines had 13 digs for Woodstock (12-4, 3-3). Pomfret 3 Marianapolis 1 THOMPSON — Ally Davis had nine kills and the Griffins avenged a five-set loss to the Golden Knights earlier this season with a 25-22, 25-23, 22-25, 25-19 victory. Bristol Shields recorded 16 assists for Pomfret (8-3). Doreen Reagan registered 15 digs and 11 assists for the Golden Knights (6-3). Windham Tech 3 Ellis Tech 1 DANIELSON — Makayla Christian recorded eight kills, 11 service points and two aces in the Mighty Tigers’ third win in a row. Allisyn Spicer added five kills, 16 service points and 24 digs for Windham Tech (10-5, 5-2 CSC East). Monet Smith had eight kills for the Eagles (2-12, 1-8). Putnam 3 Grasso Tech 1 PUTNAM — The Clippers won the last two sets to earn the CSC East win, 25-18, 16-25, 25-14, 25-19. Kiera Sebastian had three aces and three assists for Grasso (3-11, 1-6). Putnam is 4-7, 4-3. COLLEGES Keene State 2 ECSU 1 KEENE, N.H. — Alex Kallgren scored her team-high 10th goal of the season, but Eastern Connecticut State allowed a goal in the final 10 minutes and lost out on a chance to host a Little East Conference first-round playoff game for the first time. The Warriors fell to 7-6, 5-3. They are 1-4 on the road. FROM FRIDAY H.S. CROSS-COUNTRY Blues place 2nd WARWICK, R.I. — The Williams boys (49) and girls (40) cross-country teams both came in second place at the Rocky Hill School Invitational. Will Jarrett (18:05) won the boys race and Colin Madaus (19:22) came in fifth. Mary Madaus (21:37) led the Williams girls with a third-place finish and Hattie Grant (23:23) placed fifth. By The Bulletin
